website_summaries.verdict: A low-priced foot spa that includes a manual massage roller and bubbles.
pros: Comes with a removable pumice stone for your pedicure needs
Acupressure roller works wonders on foot arches
cons: Doesn't heat up water, just maintains already warm water temperature

customer_reviews.title: Good product, gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mother for Christmas and my sister and I have used it more than her so far. It is definitely a cheap product but it gets the job done. You can probably soak for a good 20-30 minutes before it starts cooling down. The bubbles are a bit weak but the roller does wonders on the arches.
customer_reviews.author: Kat M.

customer_reviews.title: iF YOU  HAVE SENSITIVE FEET THE SMALL BUMPS ON THE BOTTOM MAY BOTHER YOU
customer_reviews.text: THE COST WAS IN IN MY COMFORT ZONE AND WHAT IT DOES IS OK FOR ME. THE ONE THING I WILL HAVE TO DO TO MAKE WORK FOR ME IS TO REMOVE MANY SMALL PLASTICE BUMPS IN THE BOTTOM OF THE FOOT SPA, NOT LOOKING FORWARD TO THAT. THESE SMALL BUMPS HURT MY FEET TO THE POINT THAT IS DIFICULT TO USE THE FOOT SPA. IT MAKES ME WONDER WHY THIS WAS NOT CONSIDERED IN THE DESIGN. I MIGHT BE ABLE TO PLACE SOME THIN MATERIAL TO COVER THESE BUMPS, PROBABLY A BETTER IDEA
customer_reviews.author: J. Burton

customer_reviews.title: Love my foot spa!
customer_reviews.text: Love the foot spa, very good quality, runs quietly, love the purple/white! I would highly recommend this product.. I also purchased some of the bath salts, it will was an excellent purchase...
customer_reviews.author: Vivian M. Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Retain Heat
customer_reviews.text: Does not hold heat. Most I got was 10 minutes, at best, before the water was lukewarm. I could have gotten a $5 tubberware bowl to do the same. The container, however, does hold a good amount of water and is easy to transport, but I cannot get around the heating issue.
customer_reviews.author: Dakali

customer_reviews.title: Stupid to get excited by a free gift with this ...
customer_reviews.text: Stupid to get excited by a free gift with this item, but it was really nice and unexpected. Plus I love the tub. So does Harry my cat.
customer_reviews.author: ceejay

customer_reviews.title: Not that impressed
customer_reviews.text: It says there is a removable pumas stone which i cant find. There is a white dial looking thing that doesn't do anything so maybe it was supposed to go there. It doesn't heat the water so it got cold pretty quick and that was all for me.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Richard

customer_reviews.title: Definitely will be getting another one!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my niece for Christmas and she used it the moment she opened it! She has been using almost every day since she got it and it works great!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Zellner

customer_reviews.title: Very relaxing foot spa
customer_reviews.text: I use this foot spa daily. Provides an instant relief for my feet. Very gentle, the bubbles produced are just enough to move the water, which really helps to relax my aching feet.
customer_reviews.author: MEllingham

customer_reviews.title: Won't keep hot water hot and splashes out
customer_reviews.text: I just received this today and after using it I found 2 major issues. First off it is heated, but won't keep hot water hot. When I used it I filled it with water that was already hot and after 30 minutes of use it was luke warm at best. The second major issue is water control. For some crazy reason they placed a notch at the heal end that is lower than the rest of the bucket. When this is combined with the vigorous bubbling action you can't put much water in it without it spilling over.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Simple bubbling foot bath at a good price
customer_reviews.text: The bubbles are nice! As others have said, it doesn't warm the water(which I knew when I purchased, and that's fine). It's a good little bath, nothing spectacular, but the bubbles it produces are pretty awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Muddle

customer_reviews.title: Want your feet to feel good, get the Revlon Invigorating Pedicure Foot Spa!
customer_reviews.text: Cannot say anything bad about this Pedicure Foot Spa. It is awesome, roller rubs away foot tension, scrubber removes rough spots. The only thing I discovered is that it doesn't take much foot soak beads...mine bubbled over, but that's okay...felt so good.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: Acupressure Surface Hurts My Feet
customer_reviews.text: I finally got around to use this spa. I wanted to save money on doing my own pedicures. But. the acupressure surface in the bottom of the tub hurts my feet. :(
customer_reviews.author: Nikko

customer_reviews.title: Works great so I’m happy
customer_reviews.text: Very good for the price. Works as described. It could be a little quieter but it isn’t bad and has a good number of features.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mendez

customer_reviews.title: What I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: My daughter love it! Easy to use and works as described
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes

customer_reviews.title: ... a somewhat awkward place but other Than that a great product! Relaxes my feet perfectly
customer_reviews.text: The roller is in a somewhat awkward place but other Than that a great product! Relaxes my feet perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A holiday for your feet!
customer_reviews.text: I am very glad I purchased it! This pedicure spa does all that it states. Feet are relaxed and smooth.
customer_reviews.author: fourpugs

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and don't buy this one.
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, this has not been a winner for me. I have to fill it sitting next to the kitchen sink with my sprayer hose using the hottest water I can get, then carry it to my living room on a sheet pan to catch any sloshing around water. The water does NOT stay heated at all, and it's loud, not quiet and soothing. Honestly, my plain old plastic basin is just as good and cost only a couple of dollars. Plus, this is a pain to store when not using. I'll just enjoy my pedicure visits at the local nail salon for more soothing foot treatments, and my plastic basin with epsom salts in between visits.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Blonde

customer_reviews.title: Affordable foot spa
customer_reviews.text: This has pretty much all the features I really want in an affordable foot bath/foot spa. I like the water-spa effect and I especially like the pumice stone (great for callous-shaving once your feet are softened up by the soaking). The foot massage-roller is OK; I don't use it that much but that's just me. The heater is strong enough to keep hot water warm for an extra 10 to 15 minutes or so, which in total gives me a nice 20 to 25 minute foot bath. I'd give this five stars if it were just a bit less expensive. It's not pricey for what you get, but it's not exactly a steal, either. Overall, I'm very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell Edison

customer_reviews.title: A Let Down
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping that I would enjoy this at home pedicure spa, but I was disappointed. I purchased a pedicure spot 11 years ago that although lacking the footvare tools works much better than this. I like warm to hot water with bubbles and this is far from it. The ridges although ok for self massaging doesn’t beat my local spa. Seriously I’m a man that likes to take care of my feet and after being treating to a mani pedi by my best friend at a local nail salon this was a major disappointment. I’d keep looking for another spa or go to your local spa where you can get everything done professionally.
customer_reviews.author: BrianB

customer_reviews.title: Hey, it holds heated water.
customer_reviews.text: This was pretty much the quality I expected. I suppose I just don't have enough to expect from a device when I can give myself a perfectly serviceable foot spa with much less technology. So, did this warm water and provide a bit of bubbles? Sure did, and it was nice enough. Is this a receptacle that can hold water for soaking feet? This actually may be its most basic and handy feature. The extras that come with it are nice, respectable foot treatments. In the end, I'm pretty happy with this without expecting too much.
customer_reviews.author: Emily J. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Attractive but unexciting
customer_reviews.text: What a disappointment. I so wanted to love this machine and to have it love my aching feet. Instead it turned out to be a flop. First, the water becomes cool too quickly. Second, the bubbles are meh. They aren't much like a massage nor are they invigorating. They are just bubbles. I might have just stuck my feet under the tub faucet. My biggest complaint though is the noise. If you used this all the time I would recommend you get ear plugs or noise cancellers as it's vacuum cleaner loud. Because of the noise I would never give this as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: A Mom with Kids and Fur Kids

customer_reviews.title: Revlon Invigorating Pedicure Foot Spa
customer_reviews.text: Revlon Invigorating Pedicure Foot Spa. Well like so many others I too wish the heat stayed longer with this product. I do like that it is easy to use overall and I do enjoy a good soak after a long day on my feet. Just I tend to like very hot water and even though I will fill it with as hot as I can tolerate I find that it simply does not keep the water warm for as long as I need it to in order to really find it worth getting this out to use. I would use it more often if it could maintain a better temp longer
customer_reviews.author: 💜I Love Jellybeans

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the water warm NOT! You are lucky if you get 10 minutes of warm water . If you plan on watching tv or listening to music while you soak forget it as it is a noisy appliance. Hard to fill under a faucet, ended up filling it by putting water in my teapot and pouring it in the foot basin. It does come with various tools ( 5 piece set, clippers etc.) Toe touch controls, good luck with that!
customer_reviews.author: Angelfish

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but not quite what it should be.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty low end foot spa, but it's ok for the price point. It makes quite a bit of noise, and it doesn't maintain the heat the way it says it will, even if you start with pretty hot water. The accessories aren't great quality, but do the job. It's also not very deep and only bubbles, no massage - you can rub your feet back and forth over the bumps, though. It could make a decent gift, but if it's for mom or a loved one, definitely upgrade if you want to win hearts!
customer_reviews.author: Smartly Created

customer_reviews.title: Good addition for at home pedicures.
customer_reviews.text: Overall it is positive experience with at home foot spa. The minus is it doesn't hold hot water for long time, I'd say 5 minutes and it looses temp. Also the massager is placed wrong so I can't massage the whole foot. The stone scrub is useless, bot powerful enough and unsanitary, unless you have barbicide at home to spray it after each use. But the bubbling and massaging part is good and my feet loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Bigslacker

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: This would have been better if the water actually stayed the temp I wanted. I was kind of dissapointed with the massage part, maybe I am expecting too much but I wanted a strong massage for my aching feet, I felt some bubbles but they were not what I was expecting to feel. I think this is more of a foot soak, like if you want to soften dry skin for removal.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. ChaCha

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit and it keeps the water warm
customer_reviews.text: The best feature over our old unit is the ability to keep the water warm. It will not heat the water if you start with colder water but it will keep the temperature when using warm water to start with. Excellent massage roller and the pumice stone for the rough skin is great. Also comes with a pedicure kit. Very nice unit.
customer_reviews.author: J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great foot spa
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice foot spa. It is sturdy on the ground and doesn't tip or leak at all. It vibrates at a few different speeds, so you can adjust the massage based on your preferences. It also will keep the water warm to the right temperature, so you can enjoy a longer massage. Overall, I really enjoy using it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from regular bucket style footbaths
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure if all the bells and whistles would be worth an upgrade - but I have been proven wrong - this is delightful
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas M. Folts

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but doesn't heat
customer_reviews.text: This is an ok foot spa. As others have mentioned, the heating element isn't powerful enough to maintain temperature, much less heat. Otherwise, the construction seems fine and it is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Matthieu Hausig

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a salt bath
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice upgrade from my old footbath. There's enough room for bigger feet and it's surprisingly lightweight for such a sturdy item.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Rinehart

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: What's the point of having a foot spa if the water doesn't retain its warmth? This spa doesn't keep the water warm at all. So it's a no-go for me.
customer_reviews.author: SouthernAmazoner

customer_reviews.title: Basic not Extraordinary
customer_reviews.text: This is an inexpensive option for foot massage. I am not inpressed with it as a invigorating foot spa. It stays warm about 20 minutes. There really isn’t a massager.
customer_reviews.author: Nana Says

customer_reviews.title: I want my money back
customer_reviews.text: I paid for gift wrapping & it showed up like a package & got opened already. Was supposed to be for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Thomas-Jones

customer_reviews.title: Fatal flaw
customer_reviews.text: The literature that comes with the device claims it only "keeps water warm", not heats water. This is a tacit admission it does neither. It's a CYA move. Otherwise, this thing is great. I'm still going to throw it away. Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Goodchild

customer_reviews.title: Spa time for your feet!
customer_reviews.text: What a delicious way to end a long day! I’m not into pedicures and couldn’t possibly care less about dead skin, so that’s not my objective with this—I want something for my sore feet, and this is great! It really does keep water warm for a longer time, when I use warm water, and the roller is kind of similar to something I use for sore muscles. (The pokey things stimulate blood flow to heal/regenerate, as well as break up knots and lactic acid buildup.) My partner likes the pumice stone and other goodies, since she’s more into the pedicure part, so everyone is happy!
customer_reviews.author: Hedera Femme

customer_reviews.title: A nice-to-have
customer_reviews.text: Revlon Invigorating Pedicure Foot Spa is a nice little luxury. I generally don't have one of these in the house (and I'll get to that in a moment) so when I saw this item, I figure it would be nice to try. With a small condo with limited storage space, it is as big as I expected (which is why I've refrained from getting this type of item in the past). That said, it does feel good on occasion. It is easy to use although it is best to read the directions. Again, it is a nice-to-have and on certain occasions, it is a very nice-to-have.
customer_reviews.author: sanoe.net

customer_reviews.title: Loud Motor
customer_reviews.text: Who doesn’t like a warm foot massage? This product disappoints on that count because, though you can hear the motor loudly working, it doesn’t keep the water warm for long. It has some foot grooming tools but nothing beyond those most people who take car of their feet have on hand already. This might not affect many folks but because I have arthritis in my shoulder it’s a pain to fill, lift and move this machine around. Add to that that it’s doesnt do a great job and for me this foot spa is a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Comforting but not Too Powerful 3,5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: I agree with the others that this is a bit underwhelming in the heat and massage department but it still feels good on my feet and I just put warm water in there from the start. I like the additional items to help with my foot care and my feet do feel better when I am finished. I just have to make myself use it. It's important to make use of all of the features to get the best benefits. I've had a few of these over the years and none hae been very powerful. This is about the same. It's affordable and a good lower end model though for all that you get.
customer_reviews.author: RETSmile

customer_reviews.title: Revlon Foot Spa
customer_reviews.text: I've probably had a half-dozen similar machines over the years but what sets this one apart for me is that it has a temperature regulator. I love this feature. Too often the water would cool down in the others ones before I was ready to quit using it. This one keeps it warmer longer. It also comes with a pedicure set so you can give yourself the full treatment right in the privacy of your own home. It also has buttons that you can control with your feet. This little foot spa is the best!
customer_reviews.author: Hunting Creek

customer_reviews.title: A footbath needs to hold the temperature longer
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a deep plastic foot tub for my footbath, so thought this might be an improvement. But even with the electric booster this tub does not keep the water warm any longer. Instead, because there is less water, it cools down faster. I usually soak my feet while watching TV, but the noise from this machine gets in the way, The bubbles are nice, but not worth the racket. It comes with pedicure tools. but most women will already have them, The most important feature is the water temperature, and this fails the test.
customer_reviews.author: Herblady22

customer_reviews.title: Home pedicure foot spas just don't work
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several pedicure spas/foot baths and I have not liked one yet. I'm not sure why I keep trying out new ones. This is a budget way to recreate a spa like pedicure but it doesn't work. This would be cute for a spa-type birthday party but not for repeated use. The kit that comes with it is okay but these are items that can be purchased at the dollar store so they don't necessarily stand out as a reason to rate this product higher.
customer_reviews.author: Invalid Response

customer_reviews.title: SPA-di-dah Routine Add-on
customer_reviews.text: SPA-di-dah Routine Add-on Budgeting had me cutting costs for some of my pampering routines. I selected this to help my cost-cutting efforts; its relaxing and does well but not as pampering as aSpa visit. It keeps me somewhat pampered with bucks in my pocket without tips, upsell temptations, etc The toe-control is a plus and I KNOW my germs are mine. The equipment cleaning process and frequency at some spas DO scare me.
customer_reviews.author: Lynrie

customer_reviews.title: revlon foot spa
customer_reviews.text: the wife tried this out. her comments. snore, snore and snore. this actually put her to sleep. she said that the spa style message is the greatest feeling on her feet. that it actually felt that she was in a whirlpool with jets. she put her footers in the spa and within 15 minutes because it felt so wonderful, she fell asleep. tired acking feet--she said this would be the machine to use. after usage she said that her feet felt great
customer_reviews.author: Fred Stephen

customer_reviews.title: warm the water up
customer_reviews.text: I am not a fan of placing the water in and it only staying that temperature. It takes too long. I do like the controls and the bubbles. The massage rollers are fun. I love that it comes with the pedicure set.
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTINA

customer_reviews.title: Revlon Foot Spa
customer_reviews.text: I like this Revlon Foot Spa. I like to use this when my feet are worn out and achy. The Revlon Invigorating Pedicure Foot Spa doesn't really massage the foot, you use the roller manually but it does provide bubbles and it has a removable pumice stone. Overall, this is a functional and basic foot spa with a bonus pedicure kit!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Consumer

customer_reviews.title: a lovely treat
customer_reviews.text: relaxing and a nice treat. The only issue is keeping the water hot and then carrying this away to dump out. Easy to fill from a pitcher but getting it out is a hassle and heavy. I solved it by keeping in next to a chair next to the sink. Relaxing to sit in the kitchen with no one bugging me!
customer_reviews.author: Luisa Remy

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this some, but it gets more use from my kids, who are absolutely in love. This cleans even the grossest feet of one of my boys! Def recommend.
customer_reviews.author: OneTiredMother

customer_reviews.title: You can use it anywhere and it's very easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Very pleasant and inexpensive footbath. You can use it anywhere and it's very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Heavenly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my friend's birthday and he said that it was "Comforting, relaxing, rejuvenating and emotionally therapeutic". I'm happy that he enjoyed it
customer_reviews.author: Kevii Kevv

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Does make your feet feel good, but nothing new or revolutionary about it.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen M. Jones

product_meta.title: Revlon Invigorating Pedicure Foot Spa
product_meta.description: Give your feet a break with the all New Revlon Foot Spa Collection. Revlon is committed to help you relax, sooth and replenish your tired and achy feet. The Revlon Invigorating Pedicure Foot Spa delivers an invigorating massage with relaxing bubbles, massaging roller, removable pumice stone & 5 piece pedicure kit to keep your feet soft and nails polished. This footbath will maintain water temperature desired but will not heat up cold water, so start off with warm, hot, cold water. Foot bath is shaped to fit your feet and base is textured to stimulate blood flow after a long day at work or play.
feature_bullets: Soothing Massage, bubbles and pedicure tools for a total spa oasis
Smart Heat maintains desired water temperature for soothing relief. Will not heat up cold water. Start with desired water temperature.
Removable Pumice Stone to soften your feet

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
